scripts.build: node scripts/updateLicense.js && tsc --pretty && npm run checkTestsCompile
scripts.checkTestsCompile: echo "Checking that test source compiles..." && tsc --project __tests__/test-tsconfig.json --noEmit
scripts.prebuild: npm run clean && npm run lint && echo Using TypeScript && tsc --version
scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:integration && npm run test:system
scripts.installPlugin: npm install && npm run clean && npm run build && zowe plugins install .

imperative.rootCommandDescription: Welcome to the Zowe Tasks Plugin
imperative.name: tasks

definitions.name: run
definitions.summary: Run tasks contained in your 'zowe-tasks.yml' file
definitions.description: Run tasks contained in your 'zowe-tasks.yml' file

options.name: config-file
options.description: The configuration file to use for this run.

options.name: user-config-files
options.description: The user input configuration files to use for this run. Use additional user config files to supply or change configuration input. For example, you can supply a configuration file with default connection details and override them as needed with a second file. Useful when you need to run tasks with multiple different sets of configuration. The precedence is the order specified (leftmost takes precedence).

options.name: log-output
options.description: Specifies if you want to log the output of actions. This can be helpful as you are building your tasks to check what the results will be of an action. You can then better form your validators and JSON extractors.

options.name: regex
options.description: Indicates that the run "task" name specified is a regular expression (runs any task that matches the expression).

positionals.name: task
positionals.description: The name of the task you would like to run. Omitting this parameter runs all tasks. Use "--regex" to indicate you have supplied a regular expression and to run tasks matching your RegEx.

children.name: functions
children.description: List all available built-in functions (functions that come with this plugin).
